document_data.name: Beldrune
document_data.mainbody: '''Beldrune''' was a sage of the 8{{th}} century [[DR]]. He was sometimes an actor, too.
document_data.Activities:
As of {{yearlink|761}}, they had spent years at [[Moonshorn Tower]] attempting to recover old magical lore.{{cite book/Elminster Ascending/The Temptation of Elminster|581-586|5}}

In {{yearlink|767}}, they were selling entry to their magic classes for a gold piece per attendant.{{cite book/Elminster Ascending/The Temptation of Elminster|672-674|14}}
document_data.Description: Beldrune had some hair, and was dressed in a scarlet [[silk]] tunic that was adorned with cloth-of-gold dragons with [[emerald]]s for eyes.{{cite book/Elminster Ascending/The Temptation of Elminster|699-704|17}}
document_data.Abilities:
He wasn't a great rider.{{cite book/Elminster Ascending/The Temptation of Elminster|591-592|5}}

Beldrune was able to cast some manner of spell that allowed him to [[scry]] on distant lands.{{cite book/Elminster Ascending/The Temptation of Elminster|624-625|9}}
document_data.Relationships:
Tabarast and Beldrune had long worked together; Tabarast was the elder of the two.

Beldrune favored one of his students, [[Maglast]].
